featured.text: These seagoing mammals are among the lucky survivors of a whale-stranding last December at Cape Cod.
Under the guidance of 100% Fish, however, Icelanders are now using almost 95% of a cod.
Other groundbreaking products, including Omega-3 capsules, cold virus pretreatment sprays, and dog snacks are made from what was once cod catch detritus.
Cod skin, for example, is made into calcium supplement and energy drinks, and even as material for skin transplantation as in Oddsson’s case.

other.text: The 60 pilot whales swam ashore as a result of (A) a large winter storm off the coast of Cape Cod. (B) a behavior currently unknown to scientists.
The project not only helps Icelanders to get 30% more value from each cod than most developed countries, but also provides an effective model to promote resource efficiency worldwide. 43.
The pilot whales died on the beaches of Cape Cod due to (A) the lack of salt water to facilitate their respiration.

definition.zh_def: 鱈魚，一種常見的食用魚，通常生活在寒冷的海域。
definition.en_def: Cod, a common edible fish that typically inhabits cold marine waters.
definition.example: We had grilled cod for dinner last night.
